snippet: The cuts are the first step in Google’s plan to reinvent the company that it bought in May, and to shore up its Android mobile business and expand beyond search and software.
abstract: Motorola Mobility, ailing cellphone maker that Google bought in May, will lay off 20 percent of its work force, or 4,000 people, and close a third of its 94 offices worldwide; cuts are the first step in Google's plan to reinvent Motorola, and to shore up its Android mobile business and expand beyond search and software into the manufacture of hardware.

byline.contributor: Brian X. Chen contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The cuts are the first step in Google’s plan to reinvent the company that it bought in May, and to shore up its Android mobile business and expand beyond search and software.

headline.seo: Motorola to Cut 20% of Work Force, Part of Sweeping Change
headline.main: Motorola Set for Big Cuts as Google Reinvents It
headline.print_headline: Motorola Set For Big Cuts As Google Reinvents It
